page.title: 13Norwell & Cromwell's Schools
page.content: There is no school at{Cromwell}so children are bused to North Muskham. There is a Primary School at{Norwell on School Lane, where 2 previous schools are still standing; (1){The {18th Century Charity School}and (2) {The Church School}of 1871. Work began on the present school in{1965}and it was built in The C.L.A.S.P.design at a cost of{Â£21,593. The school was built for 70 pupils and has 3 classrooms grouped around a small hall. Meals are cooked on the premises. There is a Headmaster, 1 full time and 2 part time teachers. { The pupils come from these villages.. Norwell.......................20 Norwell Woodhouse..............5 Weston.........................3 Ossington and Sutton on Trent..2 each Carlton on Trent...............5 Egmanton.......................1
